Welcome to JRAM! Select a game from the list to play. Long-press a game card for a brief description. Use the bottom navigation to switch between Games, Stats, and Options.

Objective: Be the first player to get three of your marks (X or O) in a row, column, or diagonal.

 Setup:
 - Choose your preferred first player (X, O, or Random).
 - Set the number of games to win the entire match.
 - Select game mode: 2 Player (play against another person on the same device) or Vs. Bot (play against the AI).

 Gameplay:
 - Players take turns placing their mark on an empty cell.
 - The first player to achieve a three-in-a-row wins the game.
 - If all cells are filled and no one has three in a row, the game is a draw.

 Match:
 - The first player to win the specified number of games wins the match.
 - The toolbar shows the current score for X, O, and Ties within the match.
 - The round counter indicates the current game number out of the total required to win the match.

 Pause Menu:
 - Resume: Continue the current game.
 - Restart Game: Restarts the current game of the series (scores for the current game are reset, overall match score remains).
 - Main Menu: Returns to the game setup screen, resetting the current match.

Objective: Win rounds by choosing a hand gesture that defeats the computer's choice.

 Rules:
 - Rock crushes Scissors
 - Scissors cuts Paper
 - Paper covers Rock

 Setup:
 - Game Mode: Choose "Best Of" (win more than half of a set number of rounds) or "First To" (be the first to reach a target score).
 - Rounds/Points: Set the number of rounds for "Best Of" (must be odd) or the target score for "First To".

 Gameplay:
 - Tap Rock, Paper, or Scissors to make your move.
 - The computer will make its choice, and the round result will be displayed.
 - Scores are updated after each round.

 Pause Menu:
 - Resume: Continue playing.
 - Restart Game: Resets the current match scores and returns to the configuration panel.
 - Main Menu: Exits to the main app screen.

Objective: Score as many points as possible by solving arithmetic problems within the time limit.

 Setup (Difficulty Selection Screen):
 - Choose a difficulty: Easy, Medium, or Hard.
 - Each difficulty has different parameters for the number of operators, numbers per operation, digits per number, time per round, and scoring bonuses/penalties.
 - Review the modifiers for each difficulty before playing.
 - Tap "Play" to start the challenge.

 For detailed gameplay rules, tap the "How to Play" button on this screen, or the help icon (i) during the game.

Objective: Solve the arithmetic problem shown before the timer runs out.

 Gameplay:
 - A math problem will appear on the screen.
 - Enter your answer in the input field and tap "Submit".
 - The timer bar at the top shows your remaining time for the current round.
 - Your score and current round are displayed.
 - Previous rounds are shown in the history panel at the bottom.

 Scoring:
 - Correct answers earn points.
 - Depending on the difficulty, correct answers may add bonus time to the next round, and incorrect answers or running out of time may reduce time for the next round.
 - The game consists of 10 rounds.

 Pause Menu:
 - Resume: Continue the current round.
 - Restart Challenge: Abandons the current 10-round game and starts a new one with the same difficulty.
 - MainMenu: Exits the game and returns to the difficulty selection screen.

This screen displays your gameplay statistics for each game.

 - Tic Tac Toe: Shows winrates for Player X and Player O, overall wins/draws, and detailed stats for games played against the Bot.
 - Rock Paper Scissors: Displays your overall winrate, total wins, losses, ties, and how many times you've picked each hand (Rock, Paper, Scissors).
 - Arithmetic Challenge: Select a difficulty (Easy, Medium, Hard) to see your average points, average answer speed, and your fastest/slowest answer times for that difficulty.

 Stats are updated after you complete games.

This screen allows you to manage app settings and view information.

 - Reset All Game Stats: Tap this button to clear all your saved game statistics from the app. A confirmation dialog will appear before any data is deleted. This action cannot be undone.
 - App Version: Displays the current version of the JRAM application.
 - Developers: Shows information about the developers of this application.
